pm2000_series_models.selection_blurb: Choose the PM2110 for cost-effective, basic energy monitoring with a clear LED display. It is ideal for standalone applications where remote data access is not required beyond a simple pulse output for energy totalizing.

It provides Class A power quality measurement and is suitable for billing and network management in large buildings, data centers, and industrial settings.

ion9000_series_models.selection_blurb: The PowerLogic ION9000 is a premium revenue and power quality meter offering Class 0.1S accuracy and certified Class A power quality analysis. It provides extensive data logging, root cause analysis features like disturbance direction detection, and robust cybersecurity protocols, making it ideal for critical power applications in large facilities and utilities.

Power_quality_analysis: IEC 61000-4-30 Class A Power Quality Instrument (PQI-A) certified
Harmonics measurement up to the 63rd harmonic
Type_of_measurement: Active, reactive, and apparent power (per phase and total)
Complementary.Power_consumption_in_VA: Meter only: Max 38 VA @ 480 V | Fully optioned: Max 80 VA @ 480 V
Complementary.Display_resolution: 800 x 480 pixels WVGA (with optional remote display)
Measurement_voltage: 100–600 V L-L (Delta or Wye with unearthed neutral)
Number_of_outputs: 2 kWh energy pulsing LEDs (visible and infrared)
2 kVARh energy pulsing LEDs (visible and infrared)
Cybersecurity: Multiple user accounts with configurable access levels
Syslog support for remote event logging

Electromagnetic_compatibility: IEC 61000-4-2 (Electrostatic discharge)
IEC 61000-4-3 (Radiated fields)
IEC 61000-4-4 (Fast transients)
IEC 61000-4-5 (Surges)
IEC 61000-4-6 (Conducted disturbances)
IEC 61000-4-8 (Power frequency magnetic fields)
IEC 61000-4-11 (Voltage dips and interruptions)
IEC 61000-4-12 (Ring waves)
IEEE/ANSI C37.90.1 (Surge withstand capability)
Environment.IP_degree_of_protection: IP30 (except connectors)

ion9000_series_models.selection_blurb: The PowerLogic ION9000T extends the capabilities of the advanced ION9000 by adding high-speed transient capture. It detects sub-microsecond transients up to 10 kV with a 10 MHz sampling rate, providing unparalleled insight into transient events for mission-critical power systems.

Main.model_type: Advanced Power Quality with Transient Capture

Power_quality_analysis: High-Speed Transient Capture (10 MHz sampling, up to 10 kV)

iem3000_series_models.selection_blurb: The iEM3100 is a basic energy meter for direct measurement up to 63 A. It provides essential total and partial active energy counting, making it an economical choice for simple energy consumption monitoring and sub-metering applications.

Complementary.Accuracy_class: Active energy: Class 1 conforming to IEC 62053-21

Environment.IP_degree_of_protection: IP40 (front panel), IP20 (meter body)

iem3000_series_models.selection_blurb: The iEM3110 is a 63A direct-measure energy meter that builds on the basic model by adding a configurable pulse output for remote monitoring of energy consumption. It is suitable for integration with PLCs or other basic data acquisition systems.

Accuracy_class: Active energy: Class 1 conforming to IEC 62053-21
Active energy: Class B conforming to EN 50470-3 (MID)

Environment.IP_degree_of_protection: IP40 (front panel), IP20 (meter body)

iem3000_series_models.selection_blurb: The iEM3155 is a versatile 63A direct-measure energy meter featuring four-quadrant energy measurement, multi-tariff capabilities, and a programmable digital I/O. With its integrated Modbus communication, it is designed for cost allocation and network monitoring within a larger energy management system.

Accuracy_class: Active energy: Class 1 conforming to IEC 62053-21
Active energy: Class B conforming to EN 50470-3 (MID)
Reactive energy: Class 2 conforming to IEC 62053-23
Complementary.Input_type: Programmable (status, tariff control, or input monitoring)
Complementary.Multi_Tariff: 4 tariffs controlled by internal clock, digital input, or communications

Environment.IP_degree_of_protection: IP40 (front panel), IP20 (meter body)

iem3000_series_models.selection_blurb: The iEM3255 is a current transformer (CT) connected energy meter offering high accuracy (Class 0.5S) for billing applications. It provides four-quadrant energy measurement, a digital I/O, multi-tariff functions, and Modbus communication, making it ideal for monitoring mains or critical feeders in low and medium voltage networks.

Accuracy_class: Active energy: Class 0.5S conforming to IEC 62053-22
Active energy: Class C conforming to EN 50470-3 (MID)
Reactive energy: Class 2 conforming to IEC 62053-23
Complementary.Input_type: Programmable (status, tariff control, or input monitoring)
Complementary.Multi_Tariff: 4 tariffs controlled by internal clock, digital input, or communications

Environment.IP_degree_of_protection: IP40 (front panel), IP20 (meter body)

iem3000_series_models.selection_blurb: The iEM3355 is a high-capacity, 125A direct-measure energy meter with Modbus communication. It offers four-quadrant energy measurement, multi-tariff functions, and a programmable digital I/O, making it suitable for monitoring main switchboards or high-load feeders.
